Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The data used for the analyses described in this paper were obtained from the database of Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP), at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/gap. Genotype and phenotype data for the Osteoporotic Fractures in Men (MrOS) Study were provided by the Osteoporotic Fractures in Men Research Group. Funding support for the original study was provided by the National Institutes of Health, including the National Institute of Arthritis and Musculoskeletal and Skin Diseases (NIAMS); the National Institute on Aging (NIA); the National Center for Research Resources (NCRR); and the National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI).

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution did not respond within six months)

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Aging Related 1, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-AGR1-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Aging Related 1 and related disorders.
Data use is limited to study of diseases and disorders related to aging. This includes, but is not limited to: osteoporosis and fracture; osteoarthritis; disorders of vision and sleep; and decline of physical and cognitive function.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Aging Related 2, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-AGR2-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Aging Related 2 and related disorders.
Data use is limited to study of osteoporosis and fracture, osteoarthritis, and obesity.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Aging Related 3, RD)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-AGR3-RD
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction:
Use of the data must be related to Aging Related 3 and related disorders.
Data use is limited to study of osteoporosis and fracture; osteoarthritis; disorders of sleep and brain function; decline of physical function (frailty, sarcopenia, disability); eye disease; and obesity.
